lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Mira.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Mira.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

* Represents a Deadline task that needs to be completed by a specific date/time.
private final LocalDateTime by; // The deadline for the task
private final DateTimeFormatter DEFAULT_FORMAT = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("d/M/yyyy HHmm");
* Constructs a new Deadline task with the specified description and deadline.
* @param description The description of the Deadline task.
* @param by          The deadline by which the task must be completed.
public Deadline(String description, String by) throws DateTimeParseException {
* Constructs a new Deadline task with the specified description, deadline and isDone.
* @param description The description of the Deadline task.
* @param by          The deadline by which the task must be completed.
* @param isDone      The status of the deadline.
public Deadline(String description, String by, boolean isDone) throws DateTimeParseException {
* Return the string format of Deadline task to be saved for storage.
* @return A specified format string for storage.
* Returns a string representation of the Deadline task,
* including its type, status icon, description, and deadline.
* @return The task's type "[D]", status icon, description, and deadline.
* Represents an Event task that starts and ends at specific date/times.
private final LocalDateTime from; // The start datetime of the event
private final LocalDateTime to;   // The end datetime of the event
private final DateTimeFormatter DEFAULT_FORMAT = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("d/M/yyyy HHmm");
* Constructs a new Event task with the specified description,
* @param description The description of the Event task.
* @param from        The start datetime of the event.
* @param to          The end datetime of the event.
public Event(String description, String from, String to) throws DateTimeParseException {
* Constructs a new Event task with the specified description,
* @param description The description of the Event task.
* @param from        The start date/time of the event.
* @param to          The end date/time of the event.
* @param isDone      The status of the event.
public Event(String description, String from, String to, boolean isDone) throws DateTimeParseException {
* Return the string format of Event task to be saved for storage.
* @return A specified format string for storage.
* Returns a string representation of the Event task,
* including its type, status icon, description, start and end date/times.
* @return The task's type "[E]", status icon, description, start and end date/times.
DateTimeFormatter dateTimeFormatter = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("dd MMM yyyy, h:mma");
* Mira is a simple chatbot that echoes user commands and exits when the user types "bye".
* It interacts with the user via the UI class, which handles input and output operations.
private final UI ui; // handle user interface
private final TaskList tasks; // Manages tasks
private boolean isRunning; // default is true
public Mira(UI ui) throws IOException, SecurityException, MiraException {
* Runs the chatbot, continuously reading user commands and responding until the user types "bye".
* The chatbot echoes all commands and displays a goodbye message when exiting.
// show welcome message with multiline text
this.ui.showMessage("Hello! I'm Mira\nWhat can I do for you?");
// read user input until a newline is entered
String[] commandParts = userInput.split(" ", 2); // cam only split one time
this.ui.showMessage("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
throw new MiraException("Invalid format. Use: deadline <description> /by <deadline>");
throw new MiraException("Invalid format. Use: event <description> /from <start> /to <end>");
default -> throw new MiraException("I'm sorry, I don't understand that command.");

this.ui.showMessage("Please input a valid date: 'd/M/yyyy HHmm'.");
this.ui.showMessage("File path for storing of tasks is unusable.");
* The main method to start the Mira chatbot.
ui.showMessage("Please make sure the directory has read and write permissions.");
ui.showMessage("File path for storing of tasks is unusable.");

* Constructs a new MiraException with the specified detail message.

* Appends a single task to the storage file.
* @param task The task to be saved to the file.
* @throws IOException If an I/O error occurs while writing to the file.
public void saveTask(Task task) throws IOException {
try (FileWriter writer = new FileWriter(filePath, true)) { // Append mode

public void saveTasks(ArrayList<Task> tasks) throws IOException {

* @throws IllegalArgumentException If file content corrupts during loading.
public ArrayList<Task> loadTasks() throws IOException, SecurityException, MiraException {

* Represents a task with a description and completion status.
private final String description;  // The task's description
private boolean isDone;            // Indicates if the task is completed
* Constructs a new Task with the specified description.
* The task is initially marked as not done.
* @param description The description of the task.
* Constructs a new Task with the specified description and isDone.
* @param description The description of the task.
* @param isDone The status of the task.
* Sets the completion status of the task.
* @param status True to mark the task as done, false to mark it as not done.
* Returns the status icon representing whether the task is done.
* An "X" indicates the task is done; a space indicates it is not done.
* @return A string containing "X" if the task is done, otherwise a space.
return (this.isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done task with X
* Return the string format of task to be saved for storage.
* @return A specified format string for storage.
* Returns a string representation of the task, including its status icon.
* @return The task's status icon followed by its description.
* TaskList handles adding and listing of tasks.
private final ArrayList<Task> tasks; // Array to store tasks
private final UI ui;                 // UI for handling user interface interactions
private final Storage storage;       // Storage for saving, loading of tasks
* Constructs a new TaskList with a fixed size to store up to 100 tasks.
* @param ui UI class object needed for user interface interactions.
public TaskList(UI ui, Storage storage) throws IOException, SecurityException, MiraException {
* Adds a new task to the list and displays a confirmation message.
* @param task The task to be added.
public void addTask(Task task) throws IOException {
this.ui.showMessage("Got it. I've added this task:\n  " + task +
"\nNow you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list.");

* @param index The index of the task to delete (1-based).
public void deleteTask(int index) throws IOException {

"\nNow you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list.");
* Lists all the tasks currently stored in the task list.
StringBuilder tasksList = new StringBuilder("Here are the tasks in your list:\n");
tasksList.append("\n"); // Add newline only if it is not the last task
* Marks the specified task as done.
* @param index The index of the task to mark as done (1-based index).
public void markTask(int index) throws IOException {
this.ui.showMessage("Nice! I've marked this task as done:\n  " + tasks.get(index - 1));
* Unmarks the specified task, setting it back to not done.
* @param index The index of the task to unmark (1-based index).
public void unmarkTask(int index) throws IOException {
this.ui.showMessage("OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:\n  " + tasks.get(index - 1));
* Represents a ToDo task without any date or time attached to it.

* including its type, status icon, and description.
* @return The task's type "[T]", status icon, and description.
* UI handles all user interface interactions for the Mira chatbot,
* including reading commands, echoing user inputs, and displaying messages.
* Scanner object to read user input from the console.

* @return The command entered by the user.
* Echoes the user's command by printing it within formatted lines.
* @param command The command to be echoed.
* Displays a message to the user within formatted lines.
* @param message The message to be displayed.
* Prints a separator line used for formatting the UI output.
